sentences: Saaremaal kohtab kadakat pea igal sammul.
context: The word 'kohtamas' is the partitive case form of the verb 'kohtama'. It has several meanings: 1) To run into someone by chance, to meet accidentally (e.g., meeting friends on the street); 2) To arrange to meet someone intentionally, especially for dating purposes; 3) To notice or observe something in nature or surroundings. The partitive form 'kohtamas' is often used when describing the activity of meeting people or encountering things.
